pr_title: Issue 10277: Autonomical algorithm for calculating pollInterval.

timeline.message:
Issue 10277: Autonomical algorithm for calculating pollInterval.

We store two values in the partition table.
(1) last time we pulled
(2) time when the last poll slot reserved will trigger

We will assign the current poll to use value (2) plus a global poll value to determine when it will poll for tasks next.
Value (1) is used to detect if any poll intervals have been missed.

timeline.bodyText:
Just to be sure you are aware, with this change it is still possible that this could be a time in the past.
For example, 25800 / 1000 * 1000 + 600 evaluates to 25600.
timeline.author: njr-11

timeline.bodyText:
If the current poll itself is slightly late, this could accidentally push us past the threshold and trigger the logic after just one missed poll.  We could guard against this by adding half a poll interval:
if (now - lastUpdated > missedPollsThreshold * config.pollInterval + config.pollInterval / 2) {
